definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: Shouldn’t the revolver bounce off his chest too?
sentences.chinese: 难道左轮手枪不应该同样从他的胸口弹开吗？

sentences.english: A lover of revolvers , rivers, and the poor house.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢左轮手枪，小河和破旧的房子。

sentences.english: They're curious about your pearl-handle revolvers.
sentences.chinese: 他们对你的珍珠柄左轮手枪很好奇。

sentences.english: The markets have put a revolver to their head, he says.
sentences.chinese: 市场已经把左轮手枪指向他们的头部，他说。

sentences.english: He took his revolver from his pocket, and I did the same.
sentences.chinese: 他从衣兜里取出了左轮手枪，我也这么干了。

sentences.english: He also had a couple of revolvers with which to defend himself .
sentences.chinese: 他也备有几把左轮手枪用以防身。

sentences.english: Two revolvers had fallen to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 两支左轮手枪掉在地板上。

sentences.english: There were four notches in the handle of his revolver.
sentences.chinese: 他的左轮手枪枪柄上有四个凹槽。

sentences.english: Especially if it's a big caliber: this one felt like a . 45 Magnum.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉它有口径为45毫米的马格南左轮手枪那么大。

sentences.english: Two revolvers had fallen to the floor, but the bride had not used hers.
sentences.chinese: 两支左轮手枪都掉到了地板上，但新娘没有开枪。

sentences.english: Cased Pocket Revolver, . 28 Caliber, Massachusetts Arms Co. , Massachusetts Arms Co. , Chicopee Falls, MA.
sentences.chinese: 袖珍左轮手枪，28口径，马萨诸塞州武器公司。

sentences.english: The two rotating elements were known as "revolvers".
sentences.chinese: 两个旋转元素被称为“左轮手枪”。

sentences.english: Jack emptied his revolver into Mary's breast.
sentences.chinese: 杰克把左轮手枪的全部子弹都射进玛丽的胸膛。

sentences.english: The police found a revolver at the scene, just beside the victim's right hand.
sentences.chinese: 警察在现场发现一把左轮手枪，就在遇害者右手旁边。

sentences.english: The robber menaced him with a revolver.
sentences.chinese: 匪徒用左轮手枪威吓他。

definition: rifle (loanword)/also written 來復槍|来复枪
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
